summary: The Small Business Administration provided $1 trillion to help small businesses during the pandemic. But in some instances funds went to fraudsters—the Department of Justice charged hundreds of individuals and is investigating many more. We flagged 3.7 million recipients of SBA funds as having warning signs consistent with potential fraud. Such "indicators" aren’t proof of fraud, which is why we referred them for further review...
title: COVID Relief: Fraud Schemes and Indicators in SBA Pandemic Programs
